instructions: Ervin December 22, 2014 at 1:08 pm Any chance that i can find something similar but to bypass the geoip restriction on my xbox360 i got active subscription but i cannot do anything on it because i moved in a region where Xbox Live is not supported. Reply dave October 2, 2013 at 1:21 am If you're looking at purchasing NHL Gamecenter, switch Hola's settings to the UK and you get the international rate of $99.95 USD rather than $159.95 USD. Reply Ash Nallawalla September 2, 2013 at 11:31 am "Just head to Hola s settings you can t miss it!" Unfortunately, I can't find these settings in Firefox. The icon is enabled and I can see the preloaded ones, but nothing resembling "settings". Even the Hola FAQ happily says that new scripts can be written, but nothing that says, "Here is how a newbie can find a script and add it." Reply Justin P September 2, 2013 at 9:04 pm You'll find setting for Firefox extensions, including Hola, in the Add-Ons section of Firefox. Find Hola there, then click "Preferences". Reply Alan May 26, 2013 at 8:11 am I use ULTRASURF. It is faster and is a lightweight application. The link: http://ultrasurf.us/ Reply g May 21, 2013 at 6:17 pm Before you use Hola, you might want to read some of the terms and conditions of the EULA, such as: Automatic Uploading and Caching The Software accelerates loading of files among other means by enabling your computer to grab pieces of files from other Hola users simultaneously. Your use of the Software to download files will, in turn, enable other users to download pieces of those files from you, thereby maximizing download speeds for all users. You consent to other users' use of your network connection and resources in return for your potential use of other people's resources to assist you. Typically Hola will not enable use of your resources unless they are idle. Hola will also cache information on your hard drive for future use. I mean, /I/ was able to do it, and that's an extremely low bar. But some people get freaked out at the sight of something the looks like code... Image titled Share Photo Stream Photos from iPhone and iPad Step 1 1 Open your iPhone s . This is the app with the grey gears icon, usually found on your Home Screen. Image titled Share Photo Stream Photos from iPhone and iPad Step 2 2 Tap . You can find this at the top of the fifth set of menu options. Image titled Share Photo Stream Photos from iPhone and iPad Step 3 3 Tap . This will allow you to view the iCloud storage options for the photos on your device. Image titled Share Photo Stream Photos from iPhone and iPad Step 4 4 Slide the button next to to the On position. It will turn green when it is enabled. You will now be able to share and receive photo albums with any of your contacts. Advertisement

Image titled Share Photo Stream Photos from iPhone and iPad Step 5 1 Open . This is the app showing a colorful flower icon. You can usually find it next to your "Camera" app. Image titled Share Photo Stream Photos from iPhone and iPad Step 6 2 Tap . You can find this tab in the grey bar at the bottom of your screen. If this is your first time sharing an album, select "Get Started" in the center of your screen. If you have previously used iCloud Photo Sharing, select Sharing in the top left corner of the screen to get to the main menu. Image titled Share Photo Stream Photos from iPhone and iPad Step 7 3 Tap . This will be the blue button in the top left corner of your screen. If you do not see this button, tap "Back" to return to the iCloud Photo Sharing screen. Image titled Share Photo Stream Photos from iPhone and iPad Step 8 4 Enter the name of your Photo Album. This name will be visible to anyone you share the album with. Image titled Share Photo Stream Photos from iPhone and iPad Step 9 5 Tap . You can now select the contacts you want to share your photo album with. Image titled Share Photo Stream Photos from iPhone and iPad Step 10 6 Enter the contact names you want to share album with. Type the name or phone number of a contact with an Apple device. Image titled Share Photo Stream Photos from iPhone and iPad Step 11 7 Tap . Your shared album will now be available for photo sharing. Image titled Share Photo Stream Photos from iPhone and iPad Step 12 8 Tap on your new album. You can find this under the "Shared" tab. The title of the album will be under the gallery's icon. Image titled Share Photo Stream Photos from iPhone and iPad Step 13 9 Tap . You will now be able to add photos to your shared album. Image titled Share Photo Stream Photos from iPhone and iPad Step 14 10 Select the photos you want to share. By tapping a photo, you can share any of the pictures stored on your device. A blue checkmark will appear on the selected photos. Image titled Share Photo Stream Photos from iPhone and iPad Step 15 11 Tap . The selected photos will be uploaded to the shared album. Image titled Share Photo Stream Photos from iPhone and iPad Step 16 12 Tap . Once it s done uploading it ll notify you and ask the sender Do you wanna share this with the recipient? Yes or no. The photos added to the album will be available to the contacts who have access to the shared gallery. Advertisement
